company.name: Fyra
company.description: Fyra is a leading Helsinki-based interior architecture studio that has positioned itself as one of Finland's foremost specialists in public spaces, workplaces, and hospitality design. The name 'Fyra' means 'four' in Finnish/Swedish, referring to the four founders and their collective vision.
company.mission: Creating better habitats for humans with less resources through life-centric, research-driven design.
company.vision: To be rethinking built spaces, radically modernizing structures, and making better human habitats with less.

projects.name: Finlandia Hall
projects.description: Reimagining the bistro and café areas of Alvar Aalto's iconic 1971 congress venue. Every design decision respects the essence of the original architecture, ensuring dialogue between past and present.
projects.approach: The goal was to honor tradition while integrating modern services. We respected Aalto's design language in new solutions, ensuring they feel like a natural part of the space.

projects.name: Hotel Kämp
projects.description: Comprehensive reimagining of all 179 guest rooms and public spaces, plus 22 new rooms in the Helander House extension including the 179m² Sibelius Suite with grand piano.
projects.approach: Maintaining Kämp's heritage while cultivating calm, inviting luxury. The interiors reflect Finnish Golden Age aesthetics, inspired by Helene Schjerfbeck's works.

projects.name: EY Finland Office
projects.description: A hospitality-driven office reflecting EY's culture and workplace mission. Two 1950s-60s buildings merged with two new floors in a comprehensive two-year renovation.
projects.approach: LEED Platinum certified. 40% of furniture reused without changes, 30% given 'facelifts'. Preservation of stone floors, glass walls, and wooden structures.

projects.name: Bouchon Carême
projects.description: Located in Finland's first purpose-built department store (1900, Selim A. Lindqvist). Robust, authentic materials create a relaxed atmosphere at the intersection of tradition and modernity.
projects.approach: Authenticity and unpretentious style. Warm natural tones, solid wooden furniture, tall wooden shelves creating intimate corners, with a lively front-of-house bar.

awards.name: Prix Versailles
awards.category: 16 Most Beautiful Restaurants in the World

projects.name: Sitra Workspace
projects.description: Workplace development project for Finland's innovation fund, showcasing successful circular solutions and sustainable design practices.
projects.approach: Integration of circular economy principles with workplace development expertise.

projects.name: Original Sokos Hotel Vaakuna
projects.description: Renovation of a functionalist 1952 hotel, preserving original design elements while modernizing for contemporary needs.
projects.approach: Focus on preservation: original doors and brass numbers renovated, vintage armchairs re-upholstered, reception furniture and lamps restored.

projects.name: Box by Posti
projects.description: Bright interiors for a collection point for online orders, including recycling area and fitting rooms.
projects.approach: Innovative use of color and space for a new type of retail experience.

awards.name: Dezeen Awards
awards.category: Large Retail Interior of the Year

projects.name: Naava Oasis
projects.description: Room-within-room concept combining biophilic design with air purification, natural light, and pleasant acoustics.
projects.approach: Locally produced birch plywood frame and acrylic walls. Modular, flexible structure for open office environments.

projects.name: Konelabra
projects.description: Complete reimagination of a historic 1925-1933 red brick technical education building that had stood empty for five years.
projects.approach: Preservation central: original doors, trim, and floors restored. New architectural elements complement existing character. Seeking BREEAM In-Use certification.

sustainability.approach: Fyra believes the industry needs rethinking of built spaces. Structures need radical modernization. Better human habitats must be made with less.

nineRs.description: Fyra bases its sustainability work on the 9R strategies of circular economy, with special emphasis on the first three (Refuse, Rethink, Reduce) which have the greatest impact.

strategies.name: Refuse
strategies.description: Avoid unnecessary material consumption from the start

strategies.name: Reuse
strategies.description: Extend product life through direct reuse

strategies.name: Remanufacture
strategies.description: Create new products from old components

strategies.name: Recycle
strategies.description: Process materials into new raw materials

lca.title: Life Cycle Assessment
lca.description: Fyra has developed specialized expertise in LCA for interior projects. They use the Finnish CO2data.fi database and FiGBC framework.
achievements: First LCA-compliant interior project in Finland (Bensow case, 2023)
Published comparative LCA studies for knowledge sharing
Dedicated LCA Specialist (Ha Linh Vu, M.Sc. Materials Science)
Active participant in FiGBC working group for interior LCA framework
findings: Renovation version B had 31% higher carbon footprint than version A
Loose furniture accounts for 20-24% of total carbon footprint
Renovations every 3 years = 60 tonnes CO2e over 60 years
Renovations every 10 years = under 20 tonnes CO2e (65% reduction)

greenDeal.title: Circular Economy Green Deal
greenDeal.description: Fyra was among the first participants in Finland's Circular Economy Green Deal, committing to reduce natural resource use and set tangible goals for a low-carbon circular economy.
commitments: Develop project-specific circular economy plans for each project
Map the use of recycled materials and extent of reuse
Integrate circular economic design principles from earliest project stages

lifeCentric.title: Life-Centric Design
lifeCentric.description: Elements promoting physical, social, and mental wellbeing, together with ecological responsibility, under the guiding principle of life-centric design thinking.
lifeCentric.goal: Create solutions that fulfill functional requirements while improving people's quality of life, health, and wellbeing.

researchBased.title: Research-Based Approach
researchBased.description: Projects undergo a research phase establishing clear direction through extensive user engagement.

piloting.title: Test Lab & Piloting
piloting.description: Piloting solutions lets organizations test and refine planned initiatives before final implementation.

digitalTwins.title: Digital Twins & VR
digitalTwins.description: Fyra Metaverse Lounge transforms spaces into highly detailed, photorealistic digital replicas.
